text: solaris started out initially as a
company that was focused on
solving a problem that our customers
didn't even really know existed
they were dealing with a lot of what we
would call non-productive time or
downtime related to logistics
planning getting the materials they
needed in order to do well site
completions work
to location was becoming a challenge and
when solaris stepped into the oil and
gas field
they looked at taking an existing
solution
and finding a better way to innovate on
it
we provide sand silos chemical silos
and water silos all to the well site we
have
a real time dashboard where we can view
the inventory levels within the silos at
any given moment
our focus is there is to let's find a
way to automate what has been a manual
process
and let's find a way to integrate it so
that we can then remove people
from harmful areas on the well site
reduce the cost by having to bring
fewer amounts of equipment on location
which then
translates to an esg benefit a benefit
because we're
reducing carbon emissions and reducing
the amount of personnel needed to due
process
and that's where i'd say our aws
partnership has really grown
and now we're using the almost the full
suite of their managed services
including time stream this has changed
our ability to process data
because it allows us to ingest more than
we did in the past
at this point i believe we've tripled
the amount of data that we're receiving
i think at the end of the day what this
does is this positions solaris to be a

so you can really come to solaris and
you can count on us to be able to run
the low pressure side
efficiently and you know have software

one of the critical benefits of working

they help us scale very quickly because

they already have the domain expertise

knowledge
of what companies like solaris are
trying to do
and that's essentially like walking onto
